course.title: Social Cognitive Development: Research Seminar
course.description: Year-long lab course on children's social-cognitive development and the study of cooperation. Students develop and pilot experiments with children or participate in ongoing projects. In addition, students read and discuss papers on social cognition, understanding of norms, and cooperation from developmental and evolutionary psychology.
course.prerequisites: For undergraduates: SLS-20 and one from PSY 13, PSY 14, PSY 15, PSY 18, or SLS 15.
course.notes: Open to all undergraduates with permission of instructor.
